posts.content:
Just finished teaching a 6-hour workshop on transformer architecture at MLX8. My students' eyes were glazing over by hour 4, but they powered through! üß†

Remember: understanding attention mechanisms is like learning to ride a bike - painful at first, but once you get it, you never forget it.

Pro tip from my Meta days: when debugging a model that's not converging, the first question should always be 'Did I remember to set requires_grad=True?' 

I've lost more hours to this than I care to admit. üòÖ

#MachineLearning #Debugging #MLX8

My Albanian grandmother just asked me what I do for work. I said 'I teach computers to think like humans.' 

She replied: 'But computers are already smarter than humans, no?'

Grandma, you have no idea how right you are... üòÇ

Breaking: MLX8 is launching our new 'Build Your Own LLM' course! üöÄ

12 weeks of intensive learning, from basic neural networks to deploying your own GPT-like model.

Early bird pricing available for the first 50 students. DM me if you're interested!

#LLM #MachineLearning #Education

Just had a student ask me: 'Why do we need to understand the math behind neural networks? Can't we just use libraries?'

My response: 'You can drive a car without knowing how the engine works, but you'll be a terrible mechanic.'

Understanding the fundamentals makes you 10x better at debugging and optimization.

Coffee break thought: The best ML engineers I've worked with at Meta weren't the ones with the highest GPAs or the most papers published.

They were the ones who could explain complex concepts to a 5-year-old and debug production issues at 3 AM.

Communication + problem-solving > pure technical skills

My Italian side is showing today - just spent 2 hours explaining gradient descent over espresso and cannoli.

Student: 'So it's like rolling down a hill?'
Me: 'Exactly! But the hill is made of math and the ball is your loss function.'

Sometimes the best analogies come with good food. üáÆüáπ

Proud moment: One of my MLX8 students just got hired as an ML Engineer at Google! üéâ

She started with zero ML knowledge 6 months ago. Now she's building production models.

This is why I do what I do. Everyone deserves access to quality ML education.

#SuccessStory #MachineLearning #MLX8

Hot take: The 'AI will replace programmers' narrative is mostly fear-mongering.

AI will replace bad programmers who just copy-paste from Stack Overflow.

Good programmers who understand fundamentals, can debug, and think systematically? We're more valuable than ever.

Focus on being good, not just fast.

Just debugged a model for 6 hours only to find out the issue was a missing comma in the config file.

My Albanian temper almost made me throw my laptop out the window.

But hey, that's ML for you - 99% debugging, 1% actual machine learning. üò§

Teaching moment: A student asked why we use ReLU instead of sigmoid for hidden layers.

My answer: 'Because ReLU doesn't kill gradients like sigmoid does. It's like having a conversation vs talking to a wall.'

Sometimes the simplest explanations are the best ones. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Meta reunion dinner tonight! üçï

It's amazing how many of my former colleagues are now building their own companies or leading ML teams.

The Meta ML culture was something special - intense, collaborative, and always pushing boundaries.

Miss those late-night debugging sessions over pizza.

Weekend project: Building a small LLM that can translate between Italian and Albanian.

My grandmothers will finally be able to understand each other! üáÆüáπüá¶üá±

The model is only 50M parameters but it's surprisingly good. Sometimes smaller is better.

#PersonalProject #NLP #Multilingual

Student feedback that made my day: 'Bes, you make complex ML concepts feel like cooking recipes. Step by step, with clear instructions and lots of encouragement.'

This is exactly what I aim for! Teaching should be accessible, practical, and encouraging.

#Teaching #MachineLearning #MLX8

Just published a new tutorial on building attention mechanisms from scratch!

No frameworks, no shortcuts - just pure math and code.

Perfect for MLX8 students who want to understand what's happening under the hood.

Link in bio! üîó

#AttentionMechanisms #Tutorial #MachineLearning

Fun fact: I once spent 3 days optimizing a model at Meta, only to realize I was using the wrong loss function.

My team still hasn't let me live it down.

Lesson learned: Always double-check your assumptions, even (especially) when you're in a hurry.

#MLWarStories #Meta #LearningFromMistakes

MLX8 community update: We now have students from 15 different countries! üåç

From Albania to Zimbabwe, people are learning ML together.

This is what I dreamed of when I started - making quality ML education accessible to everyone, everywhere.

#GlobalCommunity #MachineLearning #Education

My Italian mother just asked me to explain what I do for work.

Me: 'I teach people how to make computers smarter.'
Her: 'But computers are already smart enough to beat you at chess.'

Touch√©, mamma. Touch√©. üòÖ

#ItalianMom #MachineLearning #Family

Just finished a 4-hour coding session with a student who was struggling with backpropagation.

We went through it step by step, drew diagrams, used analogies, and finally - the lightbulb moment! üí°

These moments make all the late nights worth it.

#Teaching #Backpropagation #Breakthrough

Albanian proverb of the day: 'Knowledge is like a garden - if you don't tend to it, it will wither.'

This is why I'm so passionate about teaching at MLX8. Knowledge shared is knowledge multiplied.

Every student who succeeds makes the entire field stronger.

#AlbanianWisdom #Teaching #MachineLearning
